body_html: this line data = tf.Variable(tf.zeros(_data.shape), trainable=False, collections=[]) will create two variables and an assign op, and scatter_update_op has no special treatment for memory usage. I thought only op's kernel would check tensor's initialization, I find sess.run will do it too.
body_text: this line data = tf.Variable(tf.zeros(_data.shape), trainable=False, collections=[]) will create two variables and an assign op, and scatter_update_op has no special treatment for memory usage. I thought only op's kernel would check tensor's initialization, I find sess.run will do it too.
body: this line `data = tf.Variable(tf.zeros(_data.shape), trainable=False, collections=[])` will create two variables and an assign op, and `scatter_update_op` has no special treatment for memory usage. I thought only op's kernel would check tensor's initialization, I find sess.run will do it too.
